title: Frank Lampard insists there is no cause for concern over Christian Pulisic's lack of game time at Chelsea
text:
Christian Pulisic has failed to feature in four of Chelsea’s last five games but Frank Lampard insists there is no cause for concern over his use of the USA international.

Lampard left the midfielder out of the matchday squad for the midweek Champions League win in Lille and the 21-year-old remained an unused substitute in the Premier League during September.

Pulisic began the season as a starter after his £58 million move from Borussia Dortmund but he has fallen below the likes of Willian and Mason Mount in the pecking order since the last international break with his only appearance in more than a month for the Blues coming against League Two Grimsby Town in the Carabao Cup.

"He’s level. I spoke to him two days before the Grimsby game and was very clear about the standards, and we have to give him the fact that he’s moved country and moved leagues,” said the Chelsea manager.

"He’s as young as all the young players we keep talking about. He’s just turned 21. So I think if anyone is getting too excited about this they should calm down because he’s started five games for us and what he needs to do is work, work daily, work to show within the group that he deserves to play.
